Speaker: clock
Dialogue: Tick, tock, seven o'clock.  Time to rise and open your eyes.

Speaker: clock
Dialogue: Tick, tock, seven-oh-one.  Time to get up, the day had begun.

Speaker: clock
Dialogue: Tick, tock --

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I dreamed about Mars again... it was bizarre, yet is was so real...

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: It's your time of the month again.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: At least once a month.  Douglas Quail's obsession.  For twelve years you've been talking about Mars.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: People do go to Mars, you know.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: That's right, Douglas.  But not you.  Not us.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: As it is, we can barely scrape by on your lousy ten thousand a week.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: What do they expect ... the way men dress these days ... then they scream rape.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You know -- let's really do it.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Rape men in the park?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: No.  Go to Mars.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Go to hell.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: We can pool our savings and I've got some sick leave coming, besides my regular vacation...

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: ...more of a half-wit.  For a start a war could break out there any day ...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: That's just media talk.  They're...  ...just a minority.  They're powerless.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Well, there's a lot of things we need around here before we waste our money on a trip to Mars.  We're broke.  I'm just a slave around this dump. Now if you were capable of finding a better job....

Speaker: clock
Dialogue: It's now eight.  You'll be late!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'll be late!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: No weapon again, Mr. Quail?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I keep forgetting, Herb.  They frighten me.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Yeah?  Well, it's the law, Mr. Quail.  Has been since 1990 they tell me.  Tomorrow - ya carry ya gun or ya get reported.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Okay.  Herb, okay.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: ...but Earth Intelligence Operations Director Vilos Cohaagen, clearly worried about the damage to Mars's all important tourist industry was today dismissive of the dissident groups....

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: We're dealing with a bunch of extremists and unrepresentative lunatics.  Mars is a happy and prosperous protectorate of Earth... and will remain so.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: I have no further comment.

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: Good morning, commuters.  This portion of your trip is brought to you by Rekall, Inc.  Do you have a dream that never came true?  Do you aspire - but only perspire?  Has the great adventure passed you by?  Then come to... REKALL, where what might have been will have been. For the memories of a lifetime... REKALL.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: But... is the process really that effective?  A false memory!?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Is it in any way dangerous? I mean, the medical techniques?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: It's just - incredible.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: But... I'll know I hired you. That'll destroy the whole illusion.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I won't?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: "Intelligence Agent"... wouldn't that be dangerous?  I might attack....

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I don't know... about the whole thing... it's all such a fake.  I won't really have gone.  I won't really....

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You know that's illegal.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Yeah?  Who's going to report me?  You?... wimp....

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Screwing around's illegal, too.  But just give me half a chance...

Speaker: old lady
Dialogue: Hi, I'm Doctor Sophie Lull. Sorry I'm late.  I'll be right with you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: This really going to work?

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: It the Pope Martian?

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Now, just relax, kid.  This ain't gonna hurt.  Just a controlled drip of Narkadine. When you're under, I'll just ask ya a few questions, nothin' real personal, just full details of yer private life so's we can tailor the wish-fulfillment program to your needs.

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: See?  Painless.  I didn't feel a thing.  Hey, you're a nice kid... you like a little somethin' extra?

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Good.  Now, what's the first thing you think of when you're thinkin' about Mars?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Well... I'd like to see the Martian Sphinx...

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Okay -- you will, Dougle!  I want ya to start counting backwards from a hundred for me.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: One hundred... ninety-nine... ninety-eight... ninety-seven... ninety-six... ninety-five....

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Okay, Ernie, the trip to Mars; number sixty-two... and throw in that blonde... We'll give him a real good time.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Sixty-two... and... the blonde...

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Boy, is this one wild.  He won't want to come back.

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Dougie?  This Sophie Lull. Can ya hear me?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: ...Sophie....

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Good! ... I'm gonna ask ya a few more questions now.  Ya think you'll be able to answer 'em?

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Attaboy!  To begin with, I wanna ask ya; -- You sex life.  How many orgasms a week?

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Quail?  Dougie, can you hear me?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Tell McClane what you told us.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: All of you in this room are dead.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You've broken my cover.

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: The Narkadine cracked a memory cap.  Mars --  He's really been there.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: With spontaneous breakthrough.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You've compromised the Sphinx Project.  You'll have to be silenced.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: My name isn't Quail.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I believe you, but that won't stop E.T.O. from killing you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Killing you... killing you... killing you....

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Someone at Earth Intelligence Operations erased his memory. All he know was going to Mars meant something special to him.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: What do we do?  Graft a false memory pattern over the real memory of the same thing?

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Uh-uh... That could promote a partial breakthrough of the real trip.

Speaker: lull
Dialogue: Why don't we just wipe out the memory of his visit here?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Where am I?

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Travelling south along Third Avenue, passing Fourty-third street.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Where am I going?

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Thirty-three thirteen "G" Street, Sector "L", Twin Towers, Apartment six-thirty- five.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: How did I get here?

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: I don not understand the question, sir or madam.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: How did I get into this cab?

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: You stepped into it in the normal manner, sir or madam.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Mr. Zimmer...Mr. Zimmer... help me... they're...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Where are you taking me?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: But I didn't... Are you telling me... I did go to Mars?  I don't remember?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Sphinx?... No, no, I don't, I... What about the people at Rekall?  I don't recall Rekall but you said if they know what I did?  Why don't you ask them?  They'll tell you I didn't...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What are you going to do with me?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: My God!  No!  You're going to kill me!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: No!  It's not my fault!  You can't do it!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Wait a minute, I remember --

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: On Mars... they tried to kill me... And....

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Did you know I've been to Mars?

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: What!  This stupid obsess...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I think I've been.  I vaguely recall...

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Doug, you've got to forget...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Forget?  Remembering is the problem I must've been to one of those artificial memory places...

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Oh my God...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: But something went wrong... something about a real memory... and then those men...  tried to kill me.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: What men?  Doug, you're crazy.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: You're here now.  They didn't kill you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: No.  That's what's so amazing. I killed them.  I think...

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Where?  Where are they?

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Doug!  It's something they put into your mind at the memory place.  Fantasies. That's their business.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: You're a computer operator. You're a bore.  You're a wimp.  You're not a killer.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'm involved somehow with E.I.O.  It's true.  It's no fantasy.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: Doug, I want you to see a doctor.  Now Alec and Shirley Turnbull have a good man.  He helped Alec through his breakdown.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: For fuck's sake, this is no breakdown!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: My God!  Did you say I need a psychiatrist?

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: I haven't seen you move that fast since I've known you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: How could you do it?  After eight years!

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: I'm not your wife, Quail.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Not my wife!  You are out of your mind.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: It's a false memory implant. I never saw you before six weeks ago.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Why are you lying like this?

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: No, Quail.  It's true.  You work for E.I.O.  So do I.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: But why all of this?

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: We had to watchdog you...make sure the erasure took.  A wife seemed like a good idea.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: But I remember it!  All of it!... Us!

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: All implanted.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Our friends... my work... eight years.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: The job's real -- you've had is six weeks -- since you got back from Mars.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: It's all a fabrication, Quail. Everything you know.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: This is crazy!  If all my memories are false, who am I?  What am I?  Jesus... it's like I don't exist.

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: You exist, all right.  That's the problem.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Why did you try to kill me? Why does E.I.O. want me dead?

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: They don't particularly.  That was my idea.  This assignment was boring me to death.  The personality they gave you wasn't too thrilling.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Well, what did I do on Mars that they have to keep me from telling?

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: I've no idea.  I just work here.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: All right... I'm leaving. Don't try and follow me --

Speaker: kirsten
Dialogue: I don't have to follow you. You can't get away from E.I.O. Nobody does.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: No wonder you got the role as my bitchy wife -- type casting.

Speaker: first gunman
Dialogue: Fuck it!

Speaker: earplug wearer
Dialogue: Coming in again.  Loud and clear.

Speaker: robot driver
Dialogue: You are being fired on, sir or madam, please leave the cab at once.

Speaker: robot driver
Dialogue: [Please....]

Speaker: robot driver
Dialogue: ...leave the cab as bullets are hitting the vehicle in considerable quantities.

Speaker: robot driver
Dialogue: This company, sir or madam, will institute legal action for damages...

Speaker: desk clerk
Dialogue: Help you, sir?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: A room for the night.

Speaker: desk clerk
Dialogue: ID.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Here's ten thousand.  Forget the ID.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I have a liaison with a lady... and I'm married...

Speaker: desk clerk
Dialogue: I understand, sir.  Nothing like a bit on the side, eh? Bit of fugitive flesh.  The greatest aphrodisiac is a new body, wouldn't you say, sir?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I told you, I don't want to be disturbed.

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: If you want to live, don't hand up.

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: And don't bother shaking down your clothes -- the monitor is embedded in your skull.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Who are you?  What the hell is this?

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: Take a wet towel and wrap it around your head.  That will deaden the signal.  It'll take longer for them to pinpoint you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Why should I trust you?

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: There's a real old saying - "Beggars can't be choosers". Go and soak your head!

Speaker: earphone wearer
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Cut the language, will ya?

Speaker: earphone wearer
Dialogue: It's gone!  Some...malfunction...

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Toldya the Martian assembled [stuff don't work.]

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Keep talking.

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: Head over to Skid Row -- to the Lucky Stub Pawnshop -- corner of Park Avenue and Fifty-eighth.  Tell the man you're Mr. Hotchkiss; you came for your Grecian candlesticks.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What do I want with Grecian candlesticks!

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: Just do it!  This is no time for small talk.

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: I've been tailing you since you get back from Mars.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You're E.I.O.  You're on the other team.

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: I'm E.I.O.  But I was your best friend.  Scott Stevens - we arranged this...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I can't remember - only bits...

Speaker: telephone voice
Dialogue: I was your fail-safe -- if and when the shooting started. Good luck.  Look me up if you remember me.

Speaker: earphone wearer
Dialogue: Quick.  The guy who checked in fifteen minutes ago.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Room...thirty-six.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: He was only meeting a lady... Aren't you guys overdoing it a bit?

Speaker: pawnbroker
Dialogue: You wanta camera?  I got some good, top-quality ones.  You want silk rugs?  Handmade last century in Iran...all perfect. You want videos?  Old movies... classics...all those Vietnam war ones...real quaint stuff... you want...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'm Hotchkiss...I came for the...Grecian candlesticks...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I wonder if you could tell me...

Speaker: pawnbroker
Dialogue: I trust these will look well in you... mosque.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Martian money....

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What the hell...?

Speaker: earplug wearer
Dialogue: It's come on again.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: earplug wearer
Dialogue: He's in that old flophouse. Plaza Hotel.  Central Park South.

Speaker: earplug wearer
Dialogue: Boy, he's really moving around.

Speaker: earplug wearer
Dialogue: Ya dirty rat!

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Anything?

Speaker: supervisor
Dialogue: We're running every one of his memory tapes for the past fifteen years.  Nothing yet, sir.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: There must be something -- some place he would go, some friend he would run to.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Again?!

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Are you sure the original suppression took?

Speaker: supervisor
Dialogue: Absolutely, sir.  He thinks he's Quail, a computer...

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Then how do you explain what he's doing?

Speaker: supervisor
Dialogue: Just his instincts.  He was well trained by E.I.O.... Maybe the memory cap's fractured. Portions of his prior identity could be leaking through.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: He'll remember Mars?  The Sphinx Project?

Speaker: supervisor
Dialogue: Fragments.  Nothing more. Nothing he could piece together. I did advise terminating him, rather than implanting an identify alternative.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: What do you think I am?  A barbarian?  We're not living in the twentieth century!

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Hold it there.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: It's no Garden of Eden.

Speaker: tour organiser
Dialogue: No.  Quite a bit to see, though. The canyons, the old Sphinx...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What do you know about that?

Speaker: tour oraniser
Dialogue: Not much, really.  Millions of years old.  Bit like the one that used to be in Egypt, you know...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Yeah.  Got destroyed in the Arab wars... What about this independence movement?

Speaker: tour organiser
Dialogue: Not worth worrying about. Mostly descendants of the original colonists from Earth. Now they want self-rule so they can sell us all the minerals... I don't think we've met.  You with our group?  Takes me a while to know everyone.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Sure.  Douglas Quail.

Speaker: tour organiser
Dialogue: Richard Toltz.  Well, Doug, I hope we'll see a lot more of each other.

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Smogpsucker!

Speaker: doorman
Dialogue: You know how it is, sir.  Some of these red-asses are a bit prejudiced.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Prejudiced?  Against what?

Speaker: doorman
Dialogue: Earthmen.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What are they singing?

Speaker: doorman
Dialogue: The Martian National Anthem.

Speaker: canned voice
Dialogue: "...the Martian Sphinx... only evidence of non-human civilization ever discovered ...age estimated at over eighteen million years...

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Nice to have you back with us, Mr. Hauser.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Nice to be back.  I'm flattered you remember me.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Part of my job, sir.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Do you remember my first name, too?

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Charles.  Charles Hauser, right?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'm impressed.  Listen.  I need transportation to the... uh... the Sphinx. Can you arrange it for me?

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir.  But Earth government has sealed off the excavation site completely. No one but survey teams and archaeologists are allowed closer than twenty miles.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Oh...  Do you want the item you left with us?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What item?  Oh... yes, please.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Mine's right around the corner.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: That one's closer.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: But I out-hustle him, right?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What is this, Bennie... Tombstone?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Sorta.  Bunch of miners out here got their own claims, from way back.  Cohaagen's buyin' em all up, says he's gonna cut off the air an' water if they won't sell...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'm looking for Melina Noel.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: You've found her.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: You bastard!

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: You bastard...

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Well, uh... I...

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: All right, I'll say it for you.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Don't worry.  I got the note. You discharged your obligation.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What note?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Oh, the usual one.  "Must return immediately to Earth... the wife needs me..."

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I don't have a wife.  Well, I do - but not a real wife.  Hell... look... someone else sent that note.  Someone who --

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: What are you here for?!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: For you!  I don't even know why --

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Whoever I was, I must have been a helluva guy.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: "Whoever you were"???

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Listen.  I've for to tell  you something.  I beg you to believe me... help me --

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Something happened to my mind. Memory suppression, false implant, I don't know what --

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What I'm saying is... I don't remember you.  I don't remember us.  I don't remember me --

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: [And I thought...]

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Who is us?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Memory erasure is what they use on agents.  Go away.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Wait... I was an agent -- I'm not now -- just tell me who I am!  How did we know each other?  Why are they trying to kill me?!

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: I'm not trusting you again.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You loved me once, you must have --

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: That you was a liar.  Who you are now I don't even know.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Please, Melina --

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Get out!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I need your help --

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Get out!  Get the hell away from me!

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: You don't look so good, boss. All over the Universe, women is an awful curse.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: It's a tough planet, boss.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Yeah, right.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Some guy really screwed her - screwed her up real good. Some Earthman.  Just hopped on a space shuttle.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Listen, Bennie.  You're pretty well informed?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: If that means I know it all, you're right, boss.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What do you know about the Sphinx?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: I don't know nothin'.  Not about the Sphinx.  That's out of the ball park.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I have to get there.  Can't you help me?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: No can do, mon.  You want women, cigarettes, red-market money, booze, even air or water... Bennie's your man. But the Sphinx... that's E.I.O. --

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Well... look at that one, eh?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Big cheese in town.  Big smelly cheese.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Cohaagen?  But isn't he often here?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: No way.  That cat just cheat the Martian workers without ever leavin' his place in Beverly Hills.  Somethin' must be cookin'.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Who is it?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Rekall??

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: Hello, Mr. Quail.  May I come in?  I won't be offended if you prefer to keep the gun you're holding trained on me.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: All right... come in.

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: My card, Mr. Quail.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Okay -- so you're Doctor George Edgemar of 'Rekall, Inc.'  So?

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: As I said... this is going to be very difficult -- for both of us.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'm listening.

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: Mr. Quail... I'm afraid you're not really standing here at this moment.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Sat that again.

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: I said, you're not really here.  Neither am I.  We're both in the Memory Studio -- in the offices of Rekall, Inc. On Earth.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Are you trying to tell me that this is all part of some... artificially injected fantasy? That I never really left Earth?

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: No, not quite.  We didn't give you this.  You're creating it yourself --  Remember the option we offered you?  Intelligence agent? Something inside you liked that idea, fastened on it. What you're experiencing now is a free-form delusion that you yourself are fabricating.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What is this shit you're giving me?

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: This is not -- shit, Mr. Quail. It's the truth.  I know it's very hard for you to accept, but you're having a schizophrenic reaction... we can't snap you out of the Narkadine.  You're in a world of your own fantasy.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Then how the hell can you be in my dream -- if you know it's just a dream?

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: I've been artificially implanted -- like the first part of your fantasy.  I'm actually monitoring your dream at a psychoprobe console. This is a last resort.  When somebody gets stuck in their own fantasy, we send in someone after them.  A specialist, like myself.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I don't believe a word you're saying.

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: I was afraid you'd think that. I'm sorry to have to do this, but you really are stuck.  Doctor Noel, would you come in now please?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Yes, Mr. Quail, I'm afraid it's all true.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: I tried to break through to you earlier, but you just molded me into your fantasy. Sometimes it takes Dr. Edgemar to get through to a client as tough as you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: So what's supposed to happen now?

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: Just do exactly as we tell you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Somehow that doesn't appeal to me.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Please, Mr. Quail... try to cooperate.  You're having a schizophrenic embolism.

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: If we can't get you out now... you may never come out of it. Your wife calls every day --

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: If this is a fantasy, there'll be no real consequences when I pull this trigger.

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: But there will by consequences inside your mind.  Consequences that won't hurt me... but could be fatal to you.  If you shoot me, you'll wipe me out of your fantasy -- I can't come back again.  Because to you, I'll be dead.  I can't help you get back to reality. You'll be stuck in permanent psychosis.

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: You're going to lower the gun, Mr. Quail.  You're going to hand it to me --

Speaker: edgemar
Dialogue: You're going to do exactly what I tell you --

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Watch out, Charles!  There's more of them in the hall!

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: There's an explosive in the clipboard!  He has a dead-man switch in his hand!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What happens it I come out?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: All right.  Here comes the weapon.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Back in, quick!

Speaker: waiter
Dialogue: Wouldn't you prefer your order in your room, sir?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: In!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Okay.  Answers!  Now!

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: They kidnapped me.  Said they'd kill you if I didn't cooperate.  I told them I didn't care, but then when I realized they meant it...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I don't know why they're after me, but what's your connection with all this?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: We were together before.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Believe me, I'm really sorry I can't recall the details of that encounter.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Go, Bennie, for God's sake!

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Bad news, boss lady.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Black cruiser just pull out behind us.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Forget the shooter, boss.  I lose 'em for you.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Lose them?  In this?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Hang on!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You're gonna get a ticket for that engine, Bennie --

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Yutani 650 -- you like it, boss?  Nothing like the old gas when you want a bit of speed.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: You better have two aces, Bennie.  There's a second cruiser -- and it's gaining --

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: I take it, then, you've failed to get him again.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Proceed with Operation Sphinx.

Speaker: emile
Dialogue: But, sir...

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: With him...  ...on the lose, I'm not taking any more chances. Operation Sphinx will flush him out.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What's all this?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Nothin', boss.  Just old smokies.  Only place they can come for a puff.  It's all banned topside.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: So you two are into something a bit more serious than the taxi and truck-stop business.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: That's right, boss.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: My God!... T-shirts.  They died out on Earth years ago.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Well, maybe we ain't fashion leaders, boss.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: No.  But we still believe in a free Mars.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: So where did I fit into all this?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: You - when you were Charles Hauser with E.I.O - infiltrated our group.  I guess Cohaagen didn't trust you any more when you and I...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Yeah.  And I can't even remember it.  We'll have to arrange a return bout.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: ...so he had your memory wiped and fixed you up with a new identity.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: But - the Sphinx.  Why is that stuck in my mind?  Why's it so important?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Just an ole heap o' stone, boss.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: It's more than that, Bennie, I know it's more.  Somehow it's connected.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Maybe there's a way  you can get your memory back.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: How?  What?  Where?  When?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: A bit of Martian Wisdom. We're not all stupid colonists.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: He's doing it!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What?  Why?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Clearing everyone out!  It's been rumored for months...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Wow.  I can see why I was willing to betray E.I.O.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: I though you believed in our cause?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Yes.  Of course.  That, too.

Speaker: strange man
Dialogue: Your servant, Fahreem Kuato. I greet you by the twenty-seven names that still remain, praying that you cast jewels into the darkness and given them to glow with the colors of life.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What use is this weirdo?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Ssssh...there are skills on mars that Earth has forgotten.

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: No need to introduce yourself, Mr. Quail.  Tolerate my presumption, but it does not tax my powers to know that you are the most sought-after man on two worlds.

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: -- and very little time.

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: The turbulence you hear outside is but a reflection of the turmoil within you. You have brought it to Mars in your search for yourself.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: And you're going to help me by reading my mind?

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: Indubitably.  There is only small matter of a fee.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: A fee!

Speaker: kauto
Dialogue: Naturally.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: This is for our cause!

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: Income before ideals.  Shall we say five-hundred-thousand dollars?

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: Not Martian dollars, Mr. Quail - Earth dollars.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: That's interplanetary robbery!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: With today's exchange rate... that's over two million Martian dollars!

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: What price do you put, Mr. Quail, on the future of the solar system?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Aw, come off it, man.  Just for a bit of mumbo-jumbo with a crystal ball.

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: Listen, buster, we're talking heavy stuff here.  You try and work out what's with this guy!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Okay!  Okay!  I'll pay it, but the Interstellar Trade Practices Commission might be interested in this.

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: Retrieving the past is like walking backwards along a perilous road.  The half-recalled, the half-forgotten, the repressed, the fantasies, the triumphs, joys, failures, betrayals...

Speaker: kuato
Dialogue: I will be scanning you through the Oracle Head.

Speaker: oracle head
Dialogue: Do not fear me.  I need your openness...

Speaker: oracle head
Dialogue: Open you thoughts to my presence...

Speaker: oracle head
Dialogue: Open...

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Charles!  Are you all right?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: He kept dragging you deeper and deeper into the trance! We couldn't wake either of you!

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: You stopped breathing!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Why did you kill him?  It was the next bit I really...

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: No choice, boss.  It was him or you.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Phobos and Demos!  What was that all about?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Are you okay?... Charles? Doug?  Whoever?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'm fine... only I'm not Doug -- I'm Charles Hauser... and I know everything Hauser knew.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Bennie, where's your depot?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Well... you go outta here... take a left, then down past the first... no second... water bureau you...

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Can you get us there?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: No problem.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: But why?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: We're going to the Sphinx.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Impossible, man.  Guards everywhere.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: The Oracle... what did you learn?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Only everything.  I've got total recall.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: We'll never get near the Sphinx!  They'll blow us apart!

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: What are we doing, Charles? For God's sake, tell us.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: The Sphinx... it's not some useless artifact, it's a machine built by some alien race eighteen millions years ago.  The same race that built the on one Earth... for the same purpose.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: This is what we need.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: It's a hunk of old stone, man.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Purpose?  What purpose?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Come on, Bennie, move it.  Have you heard the word, "terriform"?

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Just deliverin' some old junk to the mine out at Apidalia Planitia.  Got them people you're lookin' for in the back as well.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: The machine in the Sphinx is tapped straight down to the molten core of this planet. There are tunnels and ducts everywhere, all powered by fusion generators...

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: You sure the little man didn't fry your brain, Quail?

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: For what?  To do what?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: To combine elements in the Martian core and release them as oxygen, hydrogen and nitrogen.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: That's air!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: That's right.  Air and water. Terriforming will create a permanent livable environment for Mars.  No more pressurized cities, no more containers in the desert.  There'll be rivers, vegetation - life - the same as Earth.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: So why is Cohaagen shipping everyone out?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Don't you see?!  From being a pile of red dirt with minerals, Mars is going to change into  a chunk of priceless real estate.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: And Cohaagen's going to own it all!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Right!  He can start selling it off to well-heeled investors from Earth.  Beach condos, ski resorts, you name it.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: No wonder he wanted you to... penetrate... out group.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Once word of this gets out, the whole planet will support you.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: So what can we do?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Ruin his little scheme by terriforming ahead of schedule - while the inhabitants are still here.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: But who'll work the machine? Do you know how?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I'm the only one who does. Why do you think Cohaagen's left me alone all this time?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I was the first one inside when they cracked the riddle of the Sphinx.  It must've been programmed.  Some kind of...force...shot into me.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: But Cohaagen wiped your memory!!!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Just a way of putting me on ice.  He'd of reversed it once the planet was evacuated.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Man!  This is real complicated. Go over it again, real slow.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: What he hadn't counted on was your effect on me.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: And all without the marvels of modern science!

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Bennie, don't stop now, take it...

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: You bastard.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Like I said.  It's a tough planet.  I'm a baddie, not a goodie.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: I should have known, you were just too helpful.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: EIO Rule One, man.  Trust Nobody.  Now you can do your terriforming stuff right when those space shuttles are gone.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: But what about the Martian people?  Out cause?  I thought you believed in it.

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: Your cause?  That bunch of dead beat radicals!  When I hand in this little number...  ...I'll get real estate rights on the whole of Chryse Planitia...

Speaker: bennie
Dialogue: This makes Bennie a cut above anyone else.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Hope I've got this direction right.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: The air supply is off under the domes?

Speaker: emile
Dialogue: Yes, sir.  In a couple of hours it'll be all gone.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Any trouble with the rabble?

Speaker: emile
Dialogue: Not much, sir.  A lot of complaining.  But they're all heading towards the shuttle areas.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: We got in with this thing, but we'll never get back out.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: A shame.  Such a pleasant trip.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: This is the main tap -- straight down to the core of Mars.  When we trigger the mechanism, fusion reactors will detonate down there -- four hundred miles deep.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Remind me not to slip.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: The new elements will come booming up through this shaft -- and six thousand others all around the planet.

Speaker: guard leader
Dialogue: Stay in contact.  I want to hear from this checkpoint every four minutes.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Where'd you get that little trick?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Mail-order company.  It's a great one for fooling the wife.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: How the hell did they get in?

Speaker: security aide
Dialogue: Up the fusion core.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Up the fusion core??

Speaker: security aide
Dialogue: They're on Level One.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Seal all upper levels.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Know how to use one of these?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Catch! He hurls something toward the armed men in the elevator. Instinctively one of them reaches for the thrown object. It is an explosive device of some sort.  Quail and Melina press themselves against the wall just around a corner from the elevator.  There is a tremendous explosion.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Great stuff, but how do we get up?

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Forget them.  We'll pick up Quail once the shuttles have left for Earth.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: If you're afraid of the heights, you better get over it real quick.

Speaker: emile
Dialogue: If Quail's the only one who can operate all this...  ...then he can call all the shots.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: We'll tell him the computer's worked out the operational details so we don't really need him.  We're just doing him a favor.

Speaker: emile
Dialogue: And if that doesn't work?

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: We offer him rewards.

Speaker: emile
Dialogue: What if that doesn't work?

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: We'll torture him.  You don't think I got this far by being a nice guy?

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: First of the shuttles ready for departure, sir.  Two minute countdown.

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Seal the breach!  Repressurize!

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Those shuttles are starting up any minute.  If you know how to work this thing, you better do it now.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Don't you know how?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Yes... there's a vital connection missing...

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Don't wait!

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: If you activate the mechanism you'll die...there were glimpses of it in your memory.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Wrong, Cohaagen, there's a long tunnel, a brilliant white light, hands reaching for me...

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: That's your death.  That's what it looks like.  That's what is always looks like.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: Charles - for Mars's sake....

Speaker: cohaagen
Dialogue: It's not too late.  Join us again.  U've a lot to offer. A whole world.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: You don't deserve a new world, you and people like you made too big a mess of the old one. Time someone else had a chance.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Am I dying?

Speaker: masked miner
Dialogue: I won't lie to you, pal. You are.

Speaker: melina
Dialogue: It's happening.

Speaker: miner
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: That's just the start.  Next there'll be rain and growth and ... life.

Speaker: quail
Dialogue: Rekall could never have come up with anything like this.
